chunks.original_text: 莫谓此身缘是道，独修一物是孤阴。 夫天地间之万物，先有本而后有根，若果之有核是其本也，种之於土，阴阳激薄，则甲坼勾萌，而生根，故能长茂华实，生生不穷。 若无根株，而欲其本之久存者，未之有也。 是故天尊先指祖炁而为道之本，次明三境而为道之根，由是降本流末而生万物。 人能常无欲以观其妙，反身而诚，则范围天地，造化自我。 经曰：宇宙在乎手，万化生乎身。 非孟浪之说也。 上无复祖，唯道为身。 妙本自成，无复先祖，括囊无外，尽是道身。 道以虚无为宗，自然为本，以道为身也。 然此三者，悉无形相，寻考其理，乃是真空。 真中有精，本无名称，圣人将立教迹，不可无宗，故举虚无为道之祖。 其实三体俱会一真，形相都无，能通众妙也。 《内义》曰：天地人物品类虽殊，无别根宗，独道所化。 故《老子西升经》曰：道者，元炁虚无，混沌自然，无表无里，无有高下。 天地从之而生，万物资之而形。 又曰：有形之类，皆自道生。 《西升经》曰：天地与人物本皆道之源，俱出於太素虚无之始端。 故金液还丹亦同是而为体也。 五文开廓，普植神灵。 无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 五篇真文开廓形状，普生天地，安置神灵。 若无真文开廓，则日月不得光，星辰不得明，乾坤不得立，世界不得宁，幽魂不得度，枯骨不得生。 《内义》曰：五文在丹为五物，先天一炁之所化，依时存於室中为铅水，妙用发生之炁感而为砂木。 阳极生阴名日汞，火。 阴归阳室而为银，金。 中宫生成而为丹。 土。 分布五行，散化万神，皆一炁之妙用，为万道之根宗。 故曰五文开廓，普植神灵。 目非此而不光，心非此而不明，身非此而不立，丹非此而不成，生非此而不度，死非此而不生。 是为大梵，天中之天， 《内义》曰：此两句总结前文，是谓大道玄中之玄，以丹而言，金丹之道，散在诸经，或以清静为宗，或以虚无为宗，或言阴阳，或言造化，或言龙虎铅汞，或言神炁水火。 此经总众体而大备，析至理而无遗，故曰是为大梵天中之天也。 得之者，可以探本求源，穷神知化，宴息玄虚之境，逍遥灵宝之场，四威仪中，无非行道也。 郁罗萧台，玉山上京。 郁者，盛也。 罗者，大罗也。 大罗天上有玉京山，山上有七宝玄台，在七宝城中。 中有玉清之殿，高上玉皇治其中。 ○玉清之上有九层之台，穷於高际，参於太无，故映郁大罗之上，萧然九层之台。 大无即大罗，以玉为山，故云玉山。 山上有京，故曰上京，亦名玉京，亦名玉清，皆因玉而得名。 此即通谓之玄都玉京也。 上极无上，大罗玉清。 大罗玉清之境，穷高极远，更无一物在其上，能包罗众天，故曰大罗。 其上无尘，豁然太空，无为之道场也。 眇眇劫仞，若亡若存。 眇眇者，高远也。 劫者，譬如巨石，方圆四百里。 又如空城，方圆四百里。 上下齐等，满中芥子，天人百年一度，取一芥子。 又罗衣拂巨石，石消芥子尽，名为一劫。 故《步虚经》曰：仰观劫仞台，此之谓也。 七宝之台，非地仙所见，况凡人乎。 睹之则言有，不见则言无，故曰若亡若存。 若亡若存者，非定相也。 亦虽有形而无其体，真精造化，自然而然也。
chunks.translated_text:
Do not call this body a mere vessel of the Dao, for solitary cultivation of one thing is but solitary yin.

Among the myriad beings between Heaven and Earth, first there is the root, and only then the stem. Take the fruit with its kernel as the root; when planted in soil, yin and yang contend and fuse, the husk splits, the sprout emerges, and roots take hold—thus it grows lush, blossoms, bears fruit, and its life knows no end. Without roots and trunk, to seek the root’s enduring presence is impossible.

Therefore, the Heavenly Worthy first pointed to *Ancestral Qi* as the root of the Dao, then clarified the Three Realms as the Dao’s stem. From this, root descends and branches flow, giving rise to the myriad beings. If one can constantly be desireless to observe its wonders, turning inward to embody sincerity, then one encompasses Heaven and Earth, and creation arises from the self.

The scripture says: "The cosmos lies within the hand, the myriad transformations arise from the body." This is no reckless claim.

Above, there is no ancestor beyond the Dao; the Dao alone is the body. The wondrous root forms of itself, without prior ancestor, all-encompassing and boundless—this is the Dao-body. The Dao takes emptiness and nothingness as its宗, spontaneity as its root, and the Dao as its body.

Yet these three are all without form or appearance. Tracing their principle, they are true emptiness. Within the true lies essence, inherently without name. When the sages established teachings, they could not be without a宗, so they raised emptiness and nothingness as the Dao’s ancestor. In truth, the three bodies converge in the one real, utterly without form, yet able to penetrate all wonders.

The *Inner Meaning* says: "Though the categories of Heaven, Earth, and beings differ, they share no separate root; all are transformed by the Dao alone."

Thus the *Scripture of Laozi’s Ascent to the West* says: "The Dao is the *primordial qi* of emptiness and nothingness, the undifferentiated spontaneity, without exterior or interior, without high or low. Heaven and Earth are born from it, and the myriad beings take shape through it."

It also says: "All beings with form are born from the Dao."

The *Scripture of Ascent to the West* says: "Heaven, Earth, and beings all originate from the Dao’s source, emerging together from the primordial beginning of Great Simplicity and emptiness." Thus the Golden Elixir of Returning Cinnabar shares the same essence.

The Five Scripts unfold and establish the numinous. Without script, there is no radiance; without script, no illumination; without script, no establishment; without script, no completion; without script, no deliverance; without script, no life. The Five True Scripts unfold their forms, universally planting Heaven and Earth and arranging the numinous spirits. Without the unfolding of the True Scripts, the sun and moon would not shine, the stars would not gleam, Qian and Kun would not stand, the world would not be at peace, the hidden souls would not be delivered, and the withered bones would not live.

The *Inner Meaning* says: "Within the elixir, the Five Scripts are the Five Agents, transformed from the *primordial qi* of the Prior Heaven. Timed and stored within the chamber as *lead-water*, their wondrous function stirs and gives rise to *cinnabar-wood*. When yang reaches its extreme and generates yin, it is called *mercury*—fire. When yin returns to the yang chamber, it becomes *silver*—metal. Within the Central Palace, it is perfected as the elixir—earth. Distributed through the Five Phases, it scatters and transforms the myriad spirits, all through the wondrous function of the one *qi*, the root and宗 of the myriad Dao."

Thus it is said: "The Five Scripts unfold and establish the numinous." Without this, the eyes do not see, the heart is not bright, the body does not stand, the elixir does not form, the living are not delivered, and the dead do not live.

This is the Great Brahma, the Heaven within Heaven.

The *Inner Meaning* says: "These two lines summarize the preceding text, referring to the profound within the profound of the Great Dao. Regarding the elixir, the Way of the Golden Elixir is scattered throughout the scriptures—some take clarity and stillness as their宗, some emptiness and nothingness, some speak of yin and yang, some of creation and transformation, some of dragon and tiger, lead and mercury, some of spirit and *qi*, water and fire. This scripture encompasses all forms and is most complete, analyzing the utmost principle without omission. Thus it is called the Great Brahma, the Heaven within Heaven."

Those who attain it may plumb the root and seek the source, fathom the divine and know transformation, repose in the realm of the mysterious and empty, and wander freely in the field of the numinous treasure. In the four dignified postures, there is nothing that is not the practice of the Dao.

The lush and verdant Terrace of Great Luo, the Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital.

"Lush" means flourishing; "Luo" is the Great Luo Heaven. Above the Great Luo Heaven lies the Jade Capital Mountain, upon which stands the Seven Treasures Mystic Terrace within the Seven Treasures City. Within it is the Jade Clarity Palace, where the Highest Jade Emperor resides.

Above the Jade Clarity is a nine-tiered terrace, reaching the utmost heights, merging with the Great Nothingness. Thus it shines upon the lush Great Luo, the serene nine-tiered terrace. "Great Nothingness" is the Great Luo; as the mountain is of jade, it is called the Jade Mountain. Atop the mountain is a capital, hence the Upper Capital, also called the Jade Capital or Jade Clarity, all named for jade. This is collectively known as the Mystic Capital Jade Capital.

Above, it reaches the utmost, the Great Luo Jade Clarity. The realm of the Great Luo Jade Clarity is of boundless height and distance, with nothing above it, able to encompass all heavens—thus it is called the Great Luo. Above it is no dust, vast and open, the realm of the effortless Dao.

Vast and immeasurable, as if vanished, as if present. "Vast" means distant and far-reaching. "Eon" is like a giant stone, four hundred *li* square, or like an empty city, four hundred *li* square, equal in height and breadth, filled with mustard seeds. Every hundred years, a heavenly being takes one mustard seed. When the stone is worn away by a silk robe and the mustard seeds are exhausted, this is called one eon. Thus the *Scripture of Pacing the Void* says: "Gazing up at the Terrace of Eons"—this is what it means.

The Seven Treasures Terrace is not seen by earthly immortals, much less by ordinary people. Those who see it say it exists; those who do not say it is gone—thus it is "as if vanished, as if present." This is not a fixed appearance. Though it may have form, it has no substance, the true essence of creation, spontaneous and self-so.

chunks.original_text: 《内义》曰：郁罗萧台者，脑际也。 玉山上京者，泥丸也。 上极无上大罗玉清者，泥丸之上太玄也。 内秘一机，谓之日月高奔，神化脱胎之要。 《黄庭经》曰：高奔日月吾上道，乃见玉清虚无老者也。 眇眇劫仞，若亡若存者，性也，非象数、方色可以窥测，又非芒昧全然无物，有同太虚，恍惚窈冥，故眇眇劫仞，不可窥测也。 若亡若存，恍惚窈冥也。 经曰； 视之不足见，听之不足闻，用之不可既。 张真人曰：视之不可见其形，及至呼时又却应，莫道此声如谷响，若还无谷有何声。 三华离便，大有妙庭。 三华者，金华、玉华、九华三宫。 离便者，三宫乃玉清境离宫便殿。 大有，即高上大有。 玉清宫，天尊所御，故曰妙庭。 《内义》曰：泥丸脑际，谓之离宫，亦谓之午位，亦谓之乾宫。 三者，南方之数。 华者，华盖，亦名圆盖，乃百关总会之穴，万神朝宗之所，即泥丸脑际是矣。 离者，南方午位也。 便者，变也，阳炁至巳而极，变而生阴，阴始於午。 《龙虎经》曰：阳爻毕於巳，正阴，发离午者也。 大有者，《易》曰：火在天上大有。 离午，火也。 乾宫，天也。 妙，玄也，庭，中也。 玄则玄炁也。 玄元始之玄炁。 中则脑中也。 中者，四方之中，以指内事，则脑中、心中、脾中是也。 玄炁居於脑中，即是真阴生於离午。 以爻而言，柔居尊位，诸阳应之，象虚皇天尊凝寂玉清之上，而天地万物自然造化，生成於下者也。 金阙玉房，森罗净霐。 黄金之阙，森然焕邈，以周罗白玉之房，则精洁严凝而光莹。 《内义》曰：太玄金华玉女曰：土之精生石，石之阴精为玉，石之阳精为金。 故《金经》曰：一石之中分阴阳，为金玉，一阴一阳之谓道矣。 金阙，日也； 玉房，月也。 森罗，星宿也； 净霐，日月星宿，莹净霐澄也。 夫日月者，阴阳之精，坎离之体，乾坤之用。 日中有乌象，离中有阴月，中有兔象。 坎中有阳，阳无阴不能自耀，其魂阴无阳不能自莹。 其魄列宿环布周天为经，日月五星躔度为纬，推移寒暑，造化万物。 在丹道则为化机至药、符火妙用，故《参同契》引《易》而言天地设位，而易行其中矣。 天地者，乾坤也。 设位者，列阴阳配合之谓也。 易谓坎离。 坎离者，乾坤二用。 二用无爻位，周流行六虚，往来既不定，上下亦无常。 又曰：坎戊月精，离己日光，日月为易，刚柔相当。 易者，象也。 悬象着明，莫大乎日月。 穷神以知化，阳往则阴来。 又曰：混沌既交，接权舆、树根基，经营养鄞鄂，凝神以成躯。 真一子注曰：天地设位者，以其既济鼎器象乾坤也。 易行乎其中，阴阳离坎运於其中也。 中安金母，外施水火，运转动静，周流六虚，更为变化之宗，互作生成之本。 坎戊月精。 月，阴也； 戊，阳也。 乃阴中之阳，象水中有金虎。 离己日光。 日，阳也； 己，阴也。 乃阳中之阴，象火中有汞龙也。 故易者，象药也。 日月相合而成也。 金液大丹，合日月阴阳之精炁而成，故阴阳之炁，出入卷舒，昼夜循环，周而复始。 符火进退，阴来阳往，阳伏阴施。 混沌者，神室也。 阴阳龙虎在混沌之中，承交感之化炁，树立根基，长养鄞鄂，以至凝神成躯，终为精物。 故鼎室之中，别一天地日月之用妙矣。

The *Inner Meaning* states: "The Terrace of Lush Canopy" refers to the space between the brain. "The Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital" is the Mud-Pill Palace. "The Supreme, Unsurpassed Great Luo Jade Clarity" is the Great Mystery above the Mud-Pill. The secret inner mechanism is called the "soaring of sun and moon," the essential method of spirit-transformation and womb-escape. The *Scripture of the Yellow Court* says: "Soaring above sun and moon, I ascend the Dao—only then does one behold the Jade Clarity’s Void-and-Aged One." Vast and measureless as eons, "as if vanished, as if present"—this is the nature, not something measurable by images, numbers, directions, or colors, nor is it a dim obscurity utterly devoid of substance. It is akin to the Great Void, elusive and profound, thus "vast and measureless as eons," beyond all scrutiny. "As if vanished, as if present"—this is the elusive and profound.

The scripture says: "Gazing, it cannot be seen; listening, it cannot be heard; using, it cannot be exhausted." Master Zhang the Perfected says: "Gazing, its form cannot be seen; yet when called, it responds. Do not say this sound is like an echo in a valley—for if there were no valley, what sound would there be?"

The Three Flowers depart and transform, revealing the wondrous court of the Great Existence. The Three Flowers are the Golden Flower, Jade Flower, and Ninefold Flower—three palaces. "Depart and transform" means these three palaces are the detached halls of the Jade Clarity’s realm. "Great Existence" refers to the Supreme Great Existence. The Jade Clarity Palace is where the Heavenly Worthy presides, hence it is called the wondrous court.

The *Inner Meaning* states: The Mud-Pill’s brain-space is called the Detached Palace, also the Noon Position, also the Qian Palace. The number three corresponds to the south. "Flower" refers to the flower canopy, also called the round canopy—the cavity where all passages converge, where the myriad spirits pay homage. This is the Mud-Pill’s brain-space. "Detached" is the south’s Noon Position. "Transform" means change: when yang *qi* reaches *si* (the sixth earthly branch), it reaches its peak and transforms to generate yin, which begins at *wu* (the seventh branch). The *Scripture of Dragon and Tiger* says: "The yang line ends at *si*; true yin arises, emanating from *li* (fire) at *wu*."

"Great Existence" is explained in the *Book of Changes*: "Fire in the sky is Great Existence." *Li* and *wu* are fire; the Qian Palace is heaven. "Wondrous" is the mysterious; "court" is the center. The mysterious is the mysterious *qi*—the primordial *qi* of the Mysterious Origin. The center is the brain’s center. "Center" refers to the middle of the four directions; applied to inner matters, it means the brain’s center, heart’s center, or spleen’s center. When mysterious *qi* resides in the brain’s center, true yin is born at *li* and *wu*. In terms of hexagrams, the yielding occupies the honored position, and all yang lines respond to it. This symbolizes the August Heavenly Worthy, serene atop the Jade Clarity, while heaven, earth, and the myriad things naturally transform and take shape below.

The Golden Gates and Jade Chambers stand in solemn array, pure and luminous. The gates of gold gleam resplendently, encircling the chambers of white jade—pristine, majestic, and radiant. The *Inner Meaning* states: The Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery’s Golden Flower says: "Earth’s essence generates stone; stone’s yin essence becomes jade, and its yang essence becomes gold." Thus the *Scripture of Gold* says: "Within a single stone, yin and yang divide to become gold and jade—this is what is meant by 'one yin, one yang, that is the Dao.'"

The Golden Gates are the sun; the Jade Chambers are the moon. "Solemn array" refers to the constellations; "pure and luminous" describes the sun, moon, and stars—clear, bright, and resplendent. The sun and moon are the essence of yin and yang, the substance of *kan* and *li*, the function of *qian* and *kun*. Within the sun is the image of a crow; within *li* (fire) is the yin moon, and within it is the image of a rabbit. Within *kan* (water) is yang, but yang cannot shine without yin, just as its spirit cannot glow without yang. Its corporeal soul arranges the constellations to encircle the heavens as the warp, while the sun, moon, and five planets move through their degrees as the weft, shifting cold and heat to transform the myriad things. In the elixir path, this becomes the mechanism of transmutation, the wondrous function of talismanic fire. Thus the *Triplex Unity* cites the *Book of Changes*: "Heaven and earth establish their positions, and the *Changes* move within them."

"Heaven and earth" are *qian* and *kun*. "Establish their positions" means arranging yin and yang in proper alignment. The *Changes* refer to *kan* and *li*. *Kan* and *li* are the two functions of *qian* and *kun*. These two functions, without fixed lines, circulate through the six voids. Their coming and going are unfixed; their rising and falling have no constancy. It also says: "*Kan* is *wu*’s lunar essence; *li* is *ji*’s solar radiance. Sun and moon are the *Changes*, hard and soft in balance." The *Changes* are images. No image is more luminous than the suspended sun and moon. To fathom the spirit is to know transformation: when yang departs, yin arrives.

It also says: "Once chaos is conjoined, connect the roots, establish the foundation, cultivate and nourish the calyx, and concentrate the spirit to form the body." Master True Unity annotates: "Heaven and earth establish their positions" refers to the *ji-ji* (already-accomplished) cauldron, which symbolizes *qian* and *kun*. The *Changes* move within it—yin and yang, *li* and *kan*, operate within it. Within, the Golden Mother is settled; without, water and fire are applied. Through movement and stillness, circulation through the six voids, they become the source of transformation and the foundation of mutual generation.

"*Kan* is *wu*’s lunar essence." The moon is yin; *wu* is yang—thus it is yang within yin, symbolizing the golden tiger within water. "*Li* is *ji*’s solar radiance." The sun is yang; *ji* is yin—thus it is yin within yang, symbolizing the mercurial dragon within fire. Therefore, the *Changes* are the image of the medicine. They are formed by the union of sun and moon. The great elixir of golden fluid is created by combining the essence-*qi* of the sun and moon’s yin and yang. Thus the *qi* of yin and yang emerges and withdraws, expands and contracts, circulating day and night in an endless cycle. Talismanic fire advances and retreats; yin comes and yang goes, yang hides and yin acts.

"Chaos" is the spirit-chamber. The yin-yang dragon and tiger within chaos receive the transformative *qi* of intercourse, establishing the root, nurturing the calyx, and ultimately concentrating the spirit to form the body. Thus, within the cauldron-chamber, another heaven and earth, another sun and moon, operate wondrously.

chunks.original_text: 大行梵炁，周回十方。 玉清真道梵炁大行於十方之域，周流诸天之境。 中有度人不死之神， 诸天十方有此神主，司度世不死之事，非言神不死也。 中有南极长生之君， 即南极长生大君，主治生录者。 中有度世司马大神， 南官有度世司马，有度世大神，并治宫中，主司度世。 中有好生韩君丈人。 好生君讳猷，治南昌上宫。 韩君乃神中之尊，谓之丈人，监长生籍者。 中有南上司命司录、延寿益算、度厄尊神， 南上，洞阳宫之别名。 尊神，即南斗六司真君也。 回骸起死，无量度人。 此二句通结上文，从中有度人至此诸司真官，皆能回骸起死，劫劫度人成道。 《内义》曰：大行梵炁者，即先天纯精真一之炁藏於坤宫者也。 妙化发生，上至乾宫，阳极阴生，下降还元； 升降循环，流行不息； 故曰周回十方也。 张真人曰：只是水银，一味周流，经历诸辰。 道光曰：循行十二位，赤脚猛将军者矣。 由是阳炁日盛，长养圣胎以至度世长生，脱胎神化，修之则得，无有限量，岂非中有度人不死之神、长生之君、度世大神、好生韩君、司命司录、延寿益算度厄尊神、回骸起死、无量度人者乎！ 玄师曰：金母居西龟之山、言金之体也； 亦曰龙山，言木之道也。 乃元炁之根纽，真土之渊府。 西北之角，亥子之间，中有梵炁之主，雌一真母居焉。 万炁日夜上朝，若稍有尘心，则失大行，梵炁不能弥罗一身，修真之士可不谨哉。 已上正经，乃元始所说正文。 今日校录，诸天临轩。 今日乃赤明劫初，在浮黎国中开图校录之日。 校是比量罪福录，是记录功过。 《内义》曰：此时行功，万神聚室者也。 东方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 玄都玉京山八方诸天，皆有三千大千世界。 东方无极诸天安大堂乡大千纳贤世界。 南方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 南方诸天宛黎城大千弃贤世界。 西方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 西方诸天福堂洲大千咸行世界。 北方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 北方诸天郁单野大千清净世界。 东北无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 东北诸天福集都大千长安世界。 东南无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 东南诸天元福田大千用贤世界。 西南无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 西南诸天延福乡大千仁静世界。 西北无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 西北诸天福德野大千延贤世界。 上方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 无极无上玄都玉京紫微之中，无鞅之众飞天神王。 下方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人， 下方五岳五帝洞阴清灵北都诸宫府之众也。 《内义》曰：以身而言，上自泥丸，下至涌泉，五脏三田，百千关节之神炁也。 万神聚为一神，万炁混为一炁，挈提天地，把握阴阳之理也。 十方至真飞天神王长生度世，无量大神。 此乃总结前文，此十方真圣并主监得道成真长生度世之事。 故云：大圣无量度人。 并乘飞云，丹舆绿辇，羽盖琼轮，骖驾一朱凤，五色玄龙，建九色之节，十绝灵旛。 飞云者，三素云。 神王各乘丹霞之舆，碧霞之辇，朱雀凤凰以为盖，七宝琼玉为轮毂。 玉女建九色之节，真人持十绝之旛。 前啸九凤齐唱，后吹八鸾同鸣。 前有啸歌，则九凤齐唱； 后吹管钥，则八鸾同鸣也。
chunks.translated_text:
The Great Circulating *Fanqi* pervades the ten directions.
The True Dao of Jade Purity’s *fanqi* flows abundantly through the realms of the ten directions, circulating through the bounds of all heavens. Within it dwells the spirit who delivers people from death—
across the ten directions of all heavens, this spirit presides over the deliverance of the world from mortality, not that the spirit itself is immortal.
Within it dwells the Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen,
the Great Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen, who governs the register of life.
Within it dwells the Great Spirit Marshal who delivers the world,
in the Southern Palace resides the Marshal who delivers the world, along with the Great Spirit who delivers the world, both governing within the palace and presiding over deliverance.
Within it dwells the Venerable Lord Han, Master of Life.
The Lord of Life, named You, rules the Upper Palace of Nanchang. Lord Han is the most revered among spirits, called the Venerable Master, who oversees the register of longevity.
Within it dwell the Exalted Spirits of the Southern Upper Offices of Life and Register, of Prolonging Life and Augmenting Destiny, of Delivering from Tribulation—
the Southern Upper is another name for the Cavernous Yang Palace. The Exalted Spirits are the True Lords of the Six Offices of the Southern Dipper.
They restore bones and raise the dead, delivering countless beings.
These two lines summarize the preceding text: from the spirit who delivers people to all these offices of true officials, all possess the power to restore bones, raise the dead, and deliver beings to the Dao across kalpas.

The *Inner Meaning* states: The Great Circulating *Fanqi* is the primordial pure essence, the True One’s *qi* stored within the Kun Palace. Wondrously transforming and generating, it ascends to the Qian Palace; when yang reaches its peak, yin arises, descending to return to the origin. Ascending and descending in ceaseless circulation, it flows without end—hence it is said to pervade the ten directions. Master Zhang the Perfected says: It is merely mercury, a single flavor circulating through all the celestial bodies. Dao Guang says: It is the barefoot fierce general traversing the twelve positions. Thus, as yang-*qi* daily flourishes, it nurtures the sacred embryo to deliver the world and attain longevity, transcending the mortal form through spiritual transformation. Through cultivation, this is attained without limit—is this not the spirit who delivers people from death, the Lord of Longevity, the Great Spirit who delivers the world, the Venerable Lord Han, the Offices of Life and Register, the Prolongers of Life and Augmenters of Destiny, the Exalted Spirits who deliver from tribulation, who restore bones, raise the dead, and deliver countless beings?

The Mysterious Master says: The Metal Mother resides on Tortoise Mountain in the West, speaking of the body of metal; it is also called Dragon Mountain, speaking of the Dao of wood. It is the root and pivot of primordial *qi*, the abyssal palace of true earth. At the northwest corner, between Hai and Zi, dwells the sovereign of *fanqi*, the True Mother of the Feminine One. The myriad *qi* pay homage day and night; if even a speck of worldly thought arises, the Great Circulation is lost, and *fanqi* cannot suffuse the body. Can the cultivator of truth not be vigilant?

The above is the main scripture, the original text spoken by the Primordial Beginning. Today, it is collated and recorded as the heavens look down. Today marks the beginning of the Red Clarity Kalpa, the day of unfolding the chart and collating the records in the land of Fuli. The collation compares the records of merit and transgression. The *Inner Meaning* states: At this time, the myriad spirits gather in the chamber.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Eastern Direction—
in the Eight Directions of the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain, each of the three thousand great thousand worlds holds the Eastern Boundless Heavens’ Great Hall Township, the Great Thousand World of Gathering Worthies.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Southern Direction—
the Southern Heavens’ Wanli City, the Great Thousand World of Abandoning Worthies.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Western Direction—
the Western Heavens’ Fortune Hall Continent, the Great Thousand World of Universal Conduct.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Northern Direction—
the Northern Heavens’ Yudan Plain, the Great Thousand World of Purity.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Northeastern Direction—
the Northeastern Heavens’ Fortune Gathering Capital, the Great Thousand World of Eternal Peace.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Southeastern Direction—
the Southeastern Heavens’ Primordial Fortune Field, the Great Thousand World of Employing Worthies.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Southwestern Direction—
the Southwestern Heavens’ Longevity Township, the Great Thousand World of Benevolent Stillness.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Northwestern Direction—
the Northwestern Heavens’ Fortune Virtue Plain, the Great Thousand World of Prolonging Worthies.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Upper Direction—
within the Boundless Supreme Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital and Purple Tenuity, the countless Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings.

The Boundless Flying Heavenly Spirit-King, Great Sage of Longevity, Infinite Deliverer of Beings of the Lower Direction—
the hosts of the Five Marchmounts, Five Emperors, Cavernous Yin, Pure Numinosity, and Northern Capital’s various palaces below.

The *Inner Meaning* states: In terms of the body, from the Mud Pill above to the Bubbling Spring below, the *qi* of the five viscera, three fields, and myriad joints. The myriad spirits gather into one spirit, the myriad *qi* merge into one *qi*, grasping and lifting heaven and earth, seizing and holding the principles of yin and yang.

The Perfected Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings of the Ten Directions, Great Spirits of Longevity and Deliverance—
this summarizes the preceding text: these Perfected Sages of the ten directions all oversee the supervision of attaining the Dao, achieving perfection, longevity, and deliverance. Hence they are called the Great Sages, Infinite Deliverers of Beings. Together they ride flying clouds, cinnabar chariots, and green carriages, with feathered canopies and jade wheels, drawn by a single vermilion phoenix and five-colored dark dragons, bearing nine-colored standards and ten mystic banners. The flying clouds are the Three Pure Clouds. Each Spirit-King rides a chariot of cinnabar mist and a carriage of azure mist, with vermilion sparrows and phoenixes as canopies, and wheels of seven treasures and jade. Jade maidens bear the nine-colored standards, and Perfected Ones hold the ten mystic banners. Ahead, nine phoenixes sing in unison; behind, eight simurghs cry in harmony. Before them, there is singing and whistling, so nine phoenixes sing together; behind them, pipes and flutes sound, so eight simurghs cry in unison.

chunks.original_text: 师子白鹤，啸歌邕邕。 此钧天乐也。 天一左宫有乐器，子日玉女能吹笙竽，丑日玉女能啸歌，寅日玉女能鼓瑟，卯日玉女能击筑，辰日玉女能鼓琴，巳日玉女能撞钟击磬，午日玉女能吹箫，未日玉女能吹笳，申日玉女能为九音之歌，酉日玉女能为六变之歌，戌日玉女能作百兽鸣，亥日玉女能为天下新声之曲。 名与世同，音与俗异，而俗音凄思以促命，天音和畅以延生。 五老启途，群仙翼辕。 十方大圣、道位高尊乃感五帝前引，群仙骖乘。 五老者，东方青灵始老，姓关，讳开，字灵威仰，和春炁生万物。 南方丹灵真老，姓洞浮，讳极炎，字赤熛弩，和夏炁长万物。 中央元灵元老，姓通班，讳元氏，字含枢纽，和土炁上载九天。 西方皓灵皇老，姓上金，讳昌开，字耀魄宝，和秋炁成万物。 北方五灵玄老，姓黑节，讳灵会，字[隐侯局，和冬炁藏万物，皆天真自然之神，故曰元始五老。 非后学而成真者，自受符命，各治一方，大劫交周，其位乃易。 亿乘万骑，浮空而来。 《内义》曰：十方大神者，法身之神炁，神之御炁，阴阳杂还，万亿法象，俱备其中，故曰并乘飞云，丹舆绿辇，羽盖琼轮，骖驾朱凤，五色玄龙也。 乃若九色之节，阳精也； 十绝灵旛，阴华也； 前凤阳，先唱也； 后鸾阴，后随也。 师乃兽王，象心； 鹤乃灵禽，类性。 啸歌邕邕，神思熙熙也。 五老，启途者，祖炁妙化而为五行发畅上腾也。 群仙翼辕者，万神攒簇於元宫也。 亿乘万骑，浮空而来者，三部八景阳魂阴魄、千二百形影、万二千精光，一时混化，归於元一者也。 倾光回驾， 倾光者，流精玉光，互相辉焕。 回驾者，飞云轮毂，回旋法座。 监真度生。 十方上圣朝集帝所，监领众真而拔度群生也。 《内义》曰：倾光回驾者，坎离既济，阴阳交泰之象。 夫阳升阴随，会归鼎室，造化收摄，二炁混合，即前所谓神之御炁，阴阳杂还，法象俱备者也。 二炁，坎离阴阳也。 坎中阳爻下交离中阴爻，阳光之下倾也，故日倾光。 阴随阳升，象车驾物，内阴求摄外阳，外阳慕恋内阴，阴阳交互，故曰回驾。 由是至精感激，众阳通畅，正炁滋荣，真神化生，故曰监真度生。 诸天丞相、南昌上宫， 丞炁、相炁，能立造化。 丞相乃大罗天之神公。 南昌上宫，即朱陵宫，在于赤明和阳天中者也。 韩司主录、监生大神， 韩司，司命也，主得受炼度之录。 监生大神，主度九幽之魂者。 《内义》曰：以内而言，象法身大梵、妙化发生之炁，虽真神居於室内，若无此炁，亦莫得而生也。 执录把籍，齐到帝前。 《内义》曰：录籍者，记功罪也。 诸天司职主宰大神、斋执同会虚皇天尊之前者，乃校功量福，普度人天也。 象乎妙化之炁，归乎神室，资育生化之理，太虚之先，寂寥何有！ 祖炁既判，而阴阳分焉。 混沌之初，杳冥无朕，三才既立，而文籍生焉。 显诸仁，则为录籍； 藏诸用，则为阴阳。 若幽明无录籍，功罪何所记？ 天地无阴阳，造化何由成？ 夫阴阳者，丹道之用，离析异名，莫能尽录。 略而言之，象交驰曰龙虎，类药物曰汞砂，为化机曰坎离，在升降曰水火。 诸家殊号，以类求焉。 前者即中宫神室之所，阴阳乃金丹之妙用。 神室则金丹之枢纽，帝之所御，四海朝贡，莫不辐凑。
chunks.translated_text:
Lions and white cranes chant and sing in harmonious resonance—this is the Music of the Celestial Sphere. In the Left Palace of Heavenly Unity, there are musical instruments: on the *zi* day, Jade Maidens play the *sheng* and *yu*; on the *chou* day, Jade Maidens chant and sing; on the *yin* day, Jade Maidens pluck the zither; on the *mao* day, Jade Maidens strike the *zhu*; on the *chen* day, Jade Maidens play the *qin*; on the *si* day, Jade Maidens chime bells and strike chimes; on the *wu* day, Jade Maidens blow the *xiao*; on the *wei* day, Jade Maidens play the *jia*; on the *shen* day, Jade Maidens sing the Nine-Toned Song; on the *you* day, Jade Maidens sing the Six-Variation Song; on the *xu* day, Jade Maidens imitate the cries of a hundred beasts; and on the *hai* day, Jade Maidens compose the world’s newest melodies. Their names align with the mortal realm, yet their sounds differ from worldly music—where mortal tunes are mournful and hasten life’s end, celestial music is harmonious and prolongs existence.

The Five Elders lead the way, while hosts of immortals flank the chariot poles. The Ten Directions’ Great Sages, their Dao ranks most exalted, are moved to have the Five Emperors guide them from the front, with legions of immortals as their escort. The Five Elders are: in the East, the Azure Spirit First Elder, surnamed Guan, named Kai, styled Lingwei Yang, who harmonizes the spring *qi* to birth the myriad things; in the South, the Cinnabar Spirit True Elder, surnamed Dongfu, named Jiyan, styled Chibiao Nu, who harmonizes the summer *qi* to nurture the myriad things; in the Center, the Primordial Spirit Prime Elder, surnamed Tongban, named Yuanshi, styled Hanzhu Niu, who harmonizes the earth *qi* to uphold the Nine Heavens; in the West, the Radiant Spirit August Elder, surnamed Shangjin, named Changkai, styled Yaopo Bao, who harmonizes the autumn *qi* to ripen the myriad things; and in the North, the Five Spirits Mystic Elder, surnamed Heijie, named Linghui, styled [Yinhou Ju], who harmonizes the winter *qi* to store the myriad things. All are celestial perfected spirits of nature, thus called the Primordial Five Elders. They are not those who attain perfection through later study but receive their mandates by destiny, each governing a direction. Only when great kalpas cycle anew do their positions change.

Myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arrive floating through the void. The *Inner Meaning* states: The Ten Directions’ Great Spirits are the *qi* of the Dharma-body, the spirits that govern *qi*. Yin and yang intermingle and return, with myriad Dharma-images contained within—hence they "together ride flying clouds, cinnabar chariots, and green carriages, with feathered canopies and jade wheels, drawn by a single vermilion phoenix and five-colored dark dragons." As for the nine-colored standards, they are the essence of yang; the ten mystic banners, the splendor of yin. The phoenixes ahead are yang, leading the song; the simurghs behind are yin, following in harmony. The lion is the king of beasts, symbolizing the heart; the crane is a spirit bird, embodying nature. Their resonant chanting and singing evoke a mind at ease and joyful.

The Five Elders leading the way represent the ancestral *qi* wondrously transforming into the Five Phases, flourishing and ascending. The hosts of immortals flanking the chariot poles represent the myriad spirits gathering around the Primordial Palace. The myriad chariots and ten thousand riders arriving through the void signify the Three Divisions and Eight Sceneries—yang souls and yin spirits, the twelve hundred forms and shadows, the twelve thousand luminous essences—all merging at once and returning to the Primordial Unity.

Their radiance pours forth, their chariots turn back. "Pouring forth radiance" refers to the flowing essence of jade light, mutually illuminating and resplendent. "Turning back the chariots" refers to the flying clouds and wheel hubs revolving around the Dharma-throne. They oversee the perfection of beings and deliver the living. The Ten Directions’ exalted sages assemble at the Emperor’s abode to supervise the hosts of perfected ones and deliver the multitudes of beings.

The *Inner Meaning* states: "Pouring forth radiance and turning back the chariots" symbolize the completion of the *kan*-*li* hexagrams, the image of yin and yang in harmonious union. As yang ascends and yin follows, they converge in the cauldron chamber. Creation gathers and contracts, the two *qi* merge—this is what was previously called "the spirits governing *qi*, yin and yang intermingling, Dharma-images all contained." The two *qi* are the yin and yang of *kan* and *li*. The yang line within *kan* descends to join the yin line within *li*, causing the yang light to pour downward—hence "pouring forth radiance." Yin follows yang’s ascent, like a chariot bearing its load. Inner yin seeks to gather outer yang, while outer yang yearns for inner yin. Yin and yang intermingle—hence "turning back the chariots." Through this, the purest essence is stirred, the hosts of yang flow unimpeded, the upright *qi* flourishes, and true spirits transform and arise—hence "overseeing the perfection of beings and delivering the living."

The Prime Ministers of the Heavens and the Upper Palace of Southern Prosperity—*qi* of ministers and *qi* of chancellors, capable of establishing creation. The Prime Ministers are the divine lords of the Great Luo Heaven. The Upper Palace of Southern Prosperity is the Vermilion Numinous Palace, located within the Heaven of Crimson Clarity and Harmonious Yang.

Han, the Controller of Records, and the Great Spirit of Life-Monitoring—Han the Controller is the Deity of Destiny, overseeing the records of those who receive refinement and deliverance. The Great Spirit of Life-Monitoring governs the deliverance of souls from the Nine Dark Realms.

The *Inner Meaning* states: Inwardly, this symbolizes the *qi* of the Dharma-body’s Great Brahma, the wondrous transforming *qi* of arising and flourishing. Though the true spirit dwells within the chamber, without this *qi*, nothing could come into being.

Holding records and grasping registers, they arrive together before the Emperor. The *Inner Meaning* states: Records and registers document merits and transgressions. When the deities who govern the heavens and preside over all assemble with the ritual officers before the August Heavenly Worthy of the Void, it is to assess merits, measure blessings, and universally deliver humans and gods.

This symbolizes the *qi* of wondrous transformation returning to the spirit chamber, embodying the principle of nurturing life and transformation. Before the Great Void, what was there in the boundless silence? Once the ancestral *qi* divided, yin and yang separated. At the dawn of primordial chaos, darkness was without trace. After the Three Powers were established, documents and records arose. Manifesting benevolence, they become records and registers; concealed in function, they become yin and yang. Without records and registers in the hidden and manifest realms, how could merits and transgressions be recorded? Without yin and yang in heaven and earth, how could creation be accomplished?

Yin and yang are the functions of the cinnabar Dao. Though their names diverge when analyzed, they cannot be fully enumerated. Briefly speaking, their dynamic interplay is called Dragon and Tiger; their medicinal forms, Mercury and Cinnabar; their transformative mechanism, *Kan* and *Li*; their ascent and descent, Water and Fire. Schools name them differently—seek them by their categories.

The preceding refers to the Central Palace’s spirit chamber, where yin and yang are the wondrous functions of the Golden Elixir. The spirit chamber is the pivot of the Golden Elixir, the Emperor’s domain where all within the Four Seas pay tribute, converging like spokes toward the hub.

chunks.original_text: 神之所舍，万炁感附，莫不混凝。 神为君炁，为臣神，居室内，万炁俱聚，故曰执录把籍，齐到帝前也。 张真人曰：夫炼丹者，须洞晓阴阳，深明造化，方能追二炁於黄道，会三性於元宫。 攒簇五行，合和四象，龙吟虎啸，夫唱妇随，玉鼎汤煎，金炉火炽，玄珠有象，太一归真。 由是观之，还丹之要，无出乎阴阳，本生於道。 道生一、一生二、二生三、三生万物。 《悟真篇》云：道自虚无生一炁，便从一炁产阴阳。 阴阳再合生三体，三体重生万物昌。 夫丹者，体循造化而修之也。 其余百千异名，无穷妙义，皆从阴阳而出，如丸走盘，纵横曲直，莫得而测其实，不出其盘矣。 若夫不体造化，不循阴阳，虽有要妙之言，玄微之论，只是旁门小法，岂得与金丹同日而语哉。 然修丹之士，且当迁善改过，守戒防非，又其要在於去诈息机，清心寡欲。 机诈运变於中，则神乱气昏； 身中炁候，与天地不相符合，药无由采。 声色爱慕於外，则神驰炁散，内外造化，不相交涉，鼎无由成。 有志之士，不能去此，是却行而求前矣。 嗟夫世人逐末忘本，贱命轻身。
chunks.translated_text:
Where the spirit abides, the myriad qi respond and attach, all coalescing without exception. The spirit serves as the sovereign qi, while the spirits of the ministers dwell within the chamber—here, the myriad qi gather as one. Thus it is said: holding the records and ledgers, all arrive in unison before the Emperor.

Master Zhang the Perfected states: Those who refine the Elixir must thoroughly comprehend yin and yang and profoundly grasp the workings of creation. Only then can they pursue the two qi along the Yellow Path and unite the three natures within the Primordial Palace. They assemble the Five Agents, harmonize the Four Images, where Dragon intones and Tiger roars, husband leads and wife follows, the Jade Crucible simmers, and the Golden Furnace blazes with fire. The Mysterious Pearl takes form, and the Great One returns to truth.

From this perspective, the essence of the Returned Elixir lies in nothing beyond yin and yang, which originate from the Dao. The Dao gives birth to the One, the One to the Two, the Two to the Three, and the Three to the myriad things. As *The Awakening to Reality* states: "The Dao arises from emptiness and generates the One qi; from this One qi, yin and yang emerge. Yin and yang recombine to form the Three Bodies, and from these Three Bodies, the myriad things flourish."

The Elixir, then, is cultivated by following the patterns of creation. All other countless names and boundless wondrous meanings arise from yin and yang, like a ball rolling upon a tray—whether traversing horizontally or vertically, its true nature remains unfathomable, yet never leaves the confines of the tray.

Those who fail to embody creation’s patterns or follow yin and yang, though they may possess essential and subtle teachings, practice only peripheral and minor methods. How can these compare to the Golden Elixir?

Yet those who cultivate the Elixir must first reform their faults and uphold precepts to guard against transgressions. Above all, they must abandon deceit, still their scheming, purify their minds, and diminish desires. If cunning and calculation stir within, the spirit becomes disordered and qi muddled; the qi and signs within the body no longer align with heaven and earth, and the medicine cannot be gathered. If external attachments to sounds, forms, and desires persist, the spirit scatters and qi dissipates; inner and outer creation fail to interact, and the Crucible cannot be formed.

Those who aspire to this path yet cannot relinquish these hindrances are like one who walks backward while seeking to advance. Alas! Worldly people chase the trivial and forget the fundamental, devaluing life and treating the body with disregard.

chunks.original_text: 英雄豪杰者，为功名事业所役； 聪明特达者，为进取富贵所诱； 衣食丰足者，为营求计算所惑； 贫穷不给者，为口体交累所苦。 其有出尘之士，秪乐逸豫之康，以此谓清静无为，误矣。 是皆当面蹉过，殊不念张平叔有志士，若能修炼，何妨在市居朝之语。 使世人能以此道自任，日日拨置，少顷为之，勤行不退，必有成效，应机接物之间，毋忘回光返照，则金丹光明、常现烁烁，纵未打成一片，亦是安乐法门，益寿延年，不被业转。 如能确志，道不负人，故锺离真人有曰：皇天若负道心人，令我三徒为下鬼。 真人者，岂诳言乎？ 经曰：从事於道者，道者同於道，德者同於德，失者同於失。 同於道者，道亦乐得之； 同於德者，德亦乐得之； 同於失者，失亦乐得之。 信不足焉，有不信焉。 若夫机缄，不敢轻泄，略开线路，用启后人。 葛仙公歌曰：流珠流珠，役我区区。 奔驰四海，历徧万书。 焚尽金石，烧竭汞珠。 彼寻不见，情思若愚。 赖师传授，元炁虚无。 杳冥中起，恍惚中居。 真阴真阳，一吸一呼。 先存金鼎，次办玉炉。 离火激发，坎水规模。 玉液灌溉，洞房流酥。 真人度人，要大丈夫。 念兹在兹，语吾记吾。 彭真人曰：至道希夷微且深，烧丹先认大还心。 日爻阴偶生真汞，月卦阳奇产正金。 女妊朱砂男育雪，癸藏荧丙含壬。 两端的指铅金祖，莫向诸般取次寻。 天师虚静先生曰：神若出便收来，神返身中炁自回。 如此朝朝还暮暮，自然赤子产真胎。 浮丘伯原道歌云：虎伏龙亦藏，龙藏先伏虎。 但毕河车功，不用堤防拒。 诸子学飞仙，狂迷不得住。 左右得君臣，四物相念护。 乾坤法象成，自有真人顾。 虽曰不漏机缄，歌诗之中，要领已备。 倘有志者，研必得之。 此乃天之所授也。 580/3 随所应度，严校诸天。 随功轻重，应事开度，严校诸天，罔有遗失。 《内义》曰：金丹之道，与他术不同。 一得永得，随功受报。 十分工夫，有十分受用； 其或灭裂，则报亦灭裂。 然所修至密，无声无臭，而眇眇大罗之境，寥寥虚廓之乡，无所不关，无所不达。 谨严校录，毫发不遗。 倘勤笃无倦，必臻度世矣。 已上正文玉晨道君序述。 普告三界，无极神乡。 三界者，欲界、色界、无色界也。 无极者，十方无极世界也。 泉曲之府，北都罗酆。 下方正北有一大海，秽恶腥黑，莫测边际。 中有一山，高十万六千里，上参碧落，下入风泉，名日北都罗酆山。 近水面有一大洞，名曰阴景天宫，周回三万六千里，中有三十七狱。 主此洞者，名曰太阴天君。 山上又别有六洞六天，大魔各主其一，即太阴天君外六曹，曹吏合有三十六万人。 第一洞名纣绝阴天宫，第二洞名泰杀谅事宗天宫，第三洞名明晨耐犯武城天宫，第四洞名恬照罪气天宫，第五洞名宗灵七非天宫，第六洞名敢司连宛天宫。 若能持此六宫名，常生敬畏者，魔王保举，削落罪名，生死受赖，获福无穷。 此罗酆在天地之北外癸地。 三官九署、 三官者，天、地、水三官。 三官有九官，故曰九署。 上元天官，隶玉清境，置三官九府、三十六曹。 官僚皆结自然之炁，而为人总主。 上真自然玉虚高皇上帝、诸天帝主、上圣大神、千真已得道，及男女生命录籍，及已得道未得道百姓男女仙录罪福。
chunks.translated_text:
The heroic and the bold are enslaved by their pursuit of merit, fame, and career; the wise and the exceptional are lured by ambition, advancement, and wealth. Those with ample clothing and food are bewildered by schemes and calculations; the poor and destitute are tormented by the burdens of mere survival. Even those who stand apart from the world, delighting only in ease and comfort, mistakenly call this "purity and non-action." All these miss the truth before their very eyes, forgetting Zhang Pingshu’s words: "A man of resolve, if he cultivates the Elixir, may do so whether in the marketplace or at court."

If worldly people could take up this Way as their own task, setting aside distractions even for a brief moment each day, practicing diligently without retreat, they would surely see results. In all their interactions with the world, if they never forget to turn their light inward and return to reflection, the radiance of the Golden Elixir will ever shine brightly. Even if they have not yet forged it into a single whole, this is still a path of peace and joy, prolonging life and extending years, free from the turning of karma.

If one’s resolve is firm, the Dao will not fail them. As Immortal Zhongli Quan said: "If Heaven were to betray those of Daoist heart, it would make my three disciples into lowly ghosts." Could an immortal speak falsely?

The Scripture says: "Those who engage with the Dao become one with the Dao; those who engage with virtue become one with virtue; those who engage with loss become one with loss. Those who become one with the Dao, the Dao delights in obtaining them; those who become one with virtue, virtue delights in obtaining them; those who become one with loss, loss delights in obtaining them. Where trust is insufficient, there will be distrust."

As for the subtle mechanisms of the Dao, I dare not lightly disclose them, but I shall slightly open the path to guide those who come after. The Song of Master Ge the Immortal says:

*Flowing Pearl, Flowing Pearl,*
*You enslave my humble self.*
*I roam the four seas, traverse ten thousand texts,*
*Burn gold and stone to ash, boil mercury to naught.*
*Seeking in vain, my thoughts grow dull.*
*By the Master’s transmission, primal qi arises from emptiness,*
*Dwelling in the dim and indistinct, abiding in the vague and fleeting.*
*True yin and true yang, one inhalation, one exhalation.*
*First visualize the Golden Crucible, then prepare the Jade Furnace.*
*Stir the Fire of Li, model the Water of Kan.*
*Jade liquid irrigates, the Grotto Chamber flows with butter.*
*The Immortal delivers men—only the great of heart may grasp this.*
*Hold fast to this, remember these words.*

Immortal Peng says:
*The Supreme Dao is subtle, rare, and profound;*
*To refine the Elixir, first recognize the Great Returning Mind.*
*The sun’s hexagram, yin paired, births true mercury;*
*The moon’s trigram, yang odd, produces true gold.*
*The woman conceives cinnabar, the man nurtures snow;*
*Gui conceals fire, Bing contains Ren.*
*At the two ends lies the lead, the ancestor of metals—*
*Do not seek it haphazardly among the myriad things.*

Master Xu of the Heavenly Teacher says:
*If the spirit departs, recall it swiftly;*
*When the spirit returns to the body, qi follows of itself.*
*Thus morning and evening, day after day,*
*The true embryo of the Red Child naturally takes form.*

The *Song of the Original Dao* by Fuqiu Bo says:
*The tiger lies low, the dragon too hides;*
*The dragon hides only after the tiger submits.*
*Simply complete the work of the River Chariot,*
*No need for barriers or resistance.*
*Those who seek to become flying immortals*
*Wander in madness, unable to abide.*
*Left and right, they find lord and minister;*
*The Four Agents guard and protect one another.*
*The law and image of Qian and Kun are fulfilled—*
*Of itself, the True Person attends.*

Though I have not revealed the subtle mechanisms, the essentials are already contained within these songs and poems. If one of resolve studies them, they will surely grasp the truth. This is what Heaven has bestowed.

[580/3] According to the measure of those to be delivered, the heavens are strictly examined. According to the weight of merit, the heavens open the path to deliverance, strictly examining all, that none be lost.

The *Inner Meaning* states: The Way of the Golden Elixir differs from other arts. Once attained, it is attained forever; reward follows merit. Ten parts effort yield ten parts reward; if one’s work is flawed, so too is the recompense. Yet what is cultivated is most secret, without sound or scent, yet the vast and distant realm of Great Luo, the boundless and empty expanse, is connected to all, reaching all. Strictly examined and recorded, not a hair’s breadth is omitted. If one practices with diligence and unwavering perseverance, they will surely ascend beyond the world.

The above is the preface and exposition of the Jade Dawn Dao Lord.

A universal proclamation to the Three Realms and the Boundless Divine Realm:
The Three Realms are the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm. The Boundless refers to the ten directions of the infinite worlds.

The winding springs of the underworld, the Northern Capital of Fengdu:
In the far north below lies a great sea, foul and black, its bounds unfathomable. Within it stands a mountain, a hundred and six thousand miles high, its summit piercing the azure heavens, its base descending into the windy springs—this is the Northern Capital of Fengdu Mountain. Near the water’s surface lies a great cavern, called the Heavenly Palace of Yin Shadows, thirty-six thousand miles in circumference, containing thirty-seven hells. The lord of this cavern is the Heavenly Lord of Great Yin. Above the mountain are six other caverns, each ruled by a great demon, forming the Six Bureaus under the Heavenly Lord of Great Yin, with a combined host of three hundred and sixty thousand officials.

The first cavern is the Heavenly Palace of Zhou’s Absolute Yin; the second, the Heavenly Palace of Tai’s Lethal Judgment; the third, the Heavenly Palace of Mingchen’s Enduring Offense; the fourth, the Heavenly Palace of Tianzhao’s Sinful Qi; the fifth, the Heavenly Palace of Zongling’s Seven Transgressions; the sixth, the Heavenly Palace of Gansi’s Continuous Torment. If one can hold the names of these six palaces in reverence and awe, the demon kings will vouch for them, erasing their sins, sparing them from life and death, and granting boundless blessings. This Fengdu lies in the northernmost Gui region beyond heaven and earth.

The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus:
The Three Offices are the Offices of Heaven, Earth, and Water. Each office has three bureaus, hence the Nine Bureaus. The Upper Primordial Office of Heaven, under the Jade Pure Realm, establishes the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, with thirty-six departments. The officials are all formed from the qi of spontaneity, governing all. The Supreme Perfected of the Jade Void, the High Sovereign Emperor, the Lords of the Heavens, the Great Saints and Divine Ones, the thousand Perfected who have attained the Dao, along with the records of the lives of men and women, and the registers of blessings and sins of the hundred clans—both those who have attained the Dao and those who have not—are all under their purview.

chunks.original_text: 中元地官，隶上清境，置三宫九府四十二曹，官僚皆死者，有功德之魂，受度得任，各有年限，功满德就，升为天府仙官。 功未满者，还生人中也。 中宫总主五帝五岳、诸真人、诸地神、仙已得道者。 左宫主地上九土、土皇八极诸灵官、及生命录籍。 右宫主地上诸灵官，下元水官，隶泰清境。 置三宫九府四十二曹，官僚与中元同。 是有功德之魂，补充中宫，总主水帝，旸谷神王九江水府河伯神仙、水中大神，及仙录簿籍。 左宫主水中万精蛟龙鲸鲵，又会水母龙门度数之期，及人命录籍生死功过。 右宫主水中精魂百鬼万灵。 其详载《三元品戒经》。 十二河源。 十二河源者，月为太阴之精，诸水之母，井是天河之源，众水之泉。 每一月一周天，一年十二月皆过东井，沃黄华，濯天人之容。 上解祖考，亿劫种亲。 每三官校录，子孙有大功，玉帝即超 度其玄祖也。 疾除罪簿，落灭恶根。 一身受度，则九祖蒙恩，故令疾除於罪簿。 恶根者，恶念根性，虽死犹存，当以炼度为之涤荡也。 不得拘留，逼合鬼群。 《内义》曰：以身而言，三田为三界，上自泥丸，下至涌泉，为无极神乡。 大肠小肠为泉曲之府，肾之下为北都罗酆。 三尸九虫，乃三官九署，十二经络为十二河源，如上诸处，各皆有神。 《黄庭》、《大洞》二经，备着详悉，然此诸神皆后天之物，华竞所挠，嗜欲所汨，昏浊沉滞，不得清明。 有如人之先亡祖祢，拘系幽阴，不得超度之比。 若修炼之士，则万炁朝生门，百神守死户，顿超尘境，了悟无为，不致沉迷，沦坠苦趣矣。 元始符命，时刻升迁。 北都寒池，部卫形魂。 制魔保举，度品南宫。 死魂受炼，仙化成人。 生身受度，劫劫长存。 随劫轮转，与天齐年。 永度三徒五苦八难，超凌三界，逍遥上清。 此元始降勃，北帝卫送，幽魂制告，魔王保度，南宫受炼注生。 若死魂在世有功德，形神暂灭，鬼质受炼仙化。 或无功德，遇会受炼，即生人界。 修行至经，生身受度，劫劫长存。 或生死之根未断，但劫劫不失人身，了悟此因，善根习熟，则永度三徒五苦八难，超凌三界，逍遥上清矣。 三徒者：第一色欲门，上尸道天徒界。 第二爱欲门，中尸道人徒界。 第三贪欲门，下尸道地徒界。 此名三恶，遏人学仙之路。 五苦者：第一色累苦心门，曰泰山地狱苦道； 第二爱累苦神门，日风刀苦道； 第三贪累苦形门，曰提石负山苦道； 第四华竞苦精门，曰填海作河苦道； 第五身累苦魂门，曰吞火食炭镬汤苦道。 三徒五苦，故曰八难，总八般难也。 《内义》曰：元始符命，即元始祖炁也。 是炁出阴入阳，随刻随时，升腾生化。 子时一阳於坤官发生，是为复卦，一阳祖炁所化。 乾始於坤六阴柔爻之下，变一刚爻，阳炁用事，渐渐上腾，故曰元始符命，时刻升迁。 北都寒池，五阴之下也。 部卫形魂。 一阳之升也。 阳炁上腾，巳时至离官，六阴化为纯乾，故曰制魔保举，度品南宫。 死魂受炼，纯阴。 仙化成人。 纯阳。 生身受度者，先天一炁感附於父母构精之初，而有此身。 故曰生身。 有知之后，情窦一开，元炁日丧，以至老死。 达人志士则不然，复我之性，返我之宗，斡造化之玄微，运阴阳之妙理，有如阳极於巳而阴生於午。
chunks.translated_text:
The Middle Primordial Office of Earth, under the Supreme Clarity Realm, establishes three palaces, nine bureaus, and forty-two departments. Its officials are all the souls of the deceased who have accumulated merit and virtue, receiving deliverance to assume their posts, each with a set term. When their merit is fulfilled and virtue perfected, they ascend to become celestial officials of the Heavenly Bureaus. Those whose merit remains unfulfilled are reborn among men.

The Central Palace governs the Five Emperors and Five Sacred Peaks, all Perfected Ones, all earth deities, and those immortals who have attained the Dao. The Left Palace oversees the nine lands of the earth, the Earth Sovereign, the spirits of the eight directions, and the registers of human lives. The Right Palace governs all earthly spirit-officials.

The Lower Primordial Office of Water, under the Grand Clarity Realm, likewise establishes three palaces, nine bureaus, and forty-two departments, with officials identical in nature to those of the Middle Primordial. These are the souls of the meritorious deceased, who supplement the Central Palace. They collectively govern the Water Emperor, the Divine Kings of Yang Valley, the Nine River Water Bureaus, the River Earls, the great spirits of the waters, and the registers of immortals. The Left Palace presides over the myriad water spirits—dragons, jiao-serpents, whales, and salamanders—along with the cycles of deliverance at the Dragon Gate and the Water Mother, as well as the records of human lives, deaths, merits, and transgressions. The Right Palace governs the refined souls and myriad spirits dwelling within the waters. The details are recorded in the *Scripture of the Three Primordials’ Precepts and Commandments*.

The Twelve River Sources:
The Twelve River Sources are the moon, the essence of Great Yin and mother of all waters. Wells are the sources of the Celestial River and the springs of all waters. Each month, the moon completes a circuit of the heavens, and over twelve months, it passes through the Eastern Well, irrigating the Yellow Blossoms and bathing the countenances of the celestial beings. This dissolves the bonds of ancestors and parents across countless kalpas. Whenever the Three Offices conduct their reviews, if descendants have accrued great merit, the Jade Emperor immediately delivers their distant forebears, swiftly erasing their names from the ledgers of sins and extinguishing the roots of evil.

The "roots of evil" refer to the fundamental nature of wicked thoughts, which persist even after death and must be scoured through refinement and deliverance. They are not to be detained or forced into the company of ghosts.

The *Inner Meaning* states: In terms of the body, the Three Fields correspond to the Three Realms. From the Mud Pill Palace above to the Bubbling Spring below lies the boundless divine homeland. The large and small intestines are the winding palaces of the springs, while below the kidneys lies the Northern Capital of Fengdu. The Three Corpses and Nine Worms are the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, and the twelve meridians are the Twelve River Sources. As described above, each of these places has its own deities. The *Yellow Court* and *Great Cavern* scriptures provide thorough explanations. However, all these spirits are post-celestial entities, disturbed by the competition of flowers and obscured by desires, sinking into turbidity and stagnation, unable to attain clarity. They are like one’s deceased ancestors, bound in the dark yin realms, unable to achieve deliverance.

For those who cultivate refinement, the myriad qi converge at the Gate of Life, and the hundred spirits guard the Door of Death. They swiftly transcend the dusty realm, awakening to non-action, avoiding entanglement and the descent into bitter destinies.

The Primordial Beginning’s Mandate ensures promotion at every moment. The Cold Pool of the Northern Capital protects and escorts the forms and souls. Demons are subdued, and merits are vouched for, delivering beings to the Southern Palace for refinement. Deceased souls undergo refinement and are transformed into immortals. Those who receive deliverance in life endure across kalpas. As kalpas turn, they share the same lifespan as heaven. They forever escape the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, transcending the Three Realms and roaming freely in the Supreme Clarity.

This refers to the Primordial Beginning’s descending decree, the Northern Emperor’s escort, the proclamation to restrain the dark souls, the demon kings’ guarantee of deliverance, and the Southern Palace’s refinement and rebirth. If a deceased soul had merit and virtue in life, their form and spirit temporarily perish, and their ghostly essence undergoes refinement and immortal transformation. If they lacked merit, upon encountering the assembly, they receive refinement and are reborn in the human realm. Those who cultivate to the point of scriptural mastery receive deliverance in life and endure across kalpas. Even if the roots of life and death remain unsevered, they do not lose their human form across kalpas. Once they comprehend this cause and nurture the roots of goodness to maturity, they forever escape the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, transcending the Three Realms and roaming freely in the Supreme Clarity.

The Three Paths are:
1. The Gate of Sensual Desire, the path of the Upper Corpse leading to the celestial realm of servitude.
2. The Gate of Attachment, the path of the Middle Corpse leading to the human realm of servitude.
3. The Gate of Greed, the path of the Lower Corpse leading to the earthly realm of servitude.

These are called the Three Evils, obstructing the path to immortal study.

The Five Sufferings are:
1. The suffering of sensory entanglements afflicting the heart, known as the Hell of Mount Tai.
2. The suffering of emotional attachments afflicting the spirit, known as the Wind and Blade Hell.
3. The suffering of greed afflicting the body, known as the Hell of Carrying Stones and Mountains.
4. The suffering of floral competition afflicting the essence, known as the Hell of Filling the Sea to Make Rivers.
5. The suffering of bodily burdens afflicting the soul, known as the Hell of Swallowing Fire, Eating Coals, and Boiling Cauldrons.

The Three Paths and Five Sufferings together constitute the Eight Difficulties, encompassing all eight kinds of hardship.

The *Inner Meaning* states: The Primordial Beginning’s Mandate is the primordial ancestral qi. This qi emerges from yin and enters yang, ascending and transforming at every moment. At the zi hour, a single yang arises in the Kun Palace, forming the hexagram *Fu* (Return), born of the ancestral qi of the one yang. Qian begins beneath the six yielding lines of Kun, transforming one line into firmness, with yang qi taking charge and gradually ascending. Thus, it is called the Primordial Beginning’s Mandate, promoting at every moment.

The Cold Pool of the Northern Capital lies beneath the five yin. It protects and escorts the forms and souls. As the one yang ascends, the yang qi rises. By the si hour, it reaches the Li Palace, where the six yin transform into pure Qian. Thus, demons are subdued, merits are vouched for, and beings are delivered to the Southern Palace for refinement. Deceased souls undergo refinement in pure yin, transforming into immortals in pure yang.

Those who receive deliverance in life possess the primordial one qi, which attaches to the parents’ union at the moment of conception, giving rise to this body. Hence, it is called "receiving deliverance in life." After gaining consciousness, once the passions awaken, the primordial qi is gradually lost, leading to old age and death. The wise and determined act otherwise: they restore their nature, return to their origin, master the subtleties of creation, and operate the wondrous principles of yin and yang. This is akin to yang reaching its peak at si and yin beginning to arise at wu.
chunks.overlap_context: and Nine Bureaus, with thirty-six departments. The officials are all formed from the qi of spontaneity, governing all. The Supreme Perfected of the Jade Void, the High Sovereign Emperor, the Lords of the Heavens, the Great Saints and Divine Ones, the thousand Perfected who have attained the Dao, along with the records of the lives of men and women, and the registers of blessings and sins of the hundred clans—both those who have attained the Dao and those who have not—are all under their purview.

chunks.original_text: 六阳刚爻之下变一柔爻，阴炁用事，渐渐下降，则收敛於中宫，使圣女灵男交阴阳於神室。 飞龙伏虎，构魂魄於母胎，故曰受度。 劫劫者，日日之谓。 阳升阴降，复命归根，妙化无穷，周而复始，故曰劫劫长存。 夫阳剥於上，而复生於下，循环不息，与身终始，故曰随劫轮转，与天齐年。 功用不辍，火侯无差，则形神俱妙，与道合真，故曰永度三徒五苦八难，超凌三界，逍遥上清。 582/3 上清之天，天帝玉真，元色之景梵行。 《内义》曰：薛幽栖曰：上清之天天帝者，即三十六天帝。 最尊极者，道齐元始，位列玉清，故曰玉真。 此即上清以下三十六天，不同三十二天也。 有景无色，故云梵行。 梵行者，道中之道，天中之天，出入无间，真空无碍也。 以内而言，丹成纯阳乾金之象，乾用九金，数四九四三十六矣。 道齐元始，均一炁也。 位列玉清，妙一贯也。 金归性初，故得有景无色，还丹之功到此则群阴剥尽，阳体纯全，心识莹然，升玄入妙，如秋空之澄碧，若寒潭之静渊。 稍异毫芒，则眯人目。 安能造於无色之景梵行者乎？ 太黄皇曾天帝郁褴玉明，正音云：开玄摄明天炁黄，系梵炁。 太明玉完天帝须阿那田，正音云：保玄道灵天炁绿，系璧宿。 清明何童天帝元育齐京，正音云：明生九真天炁青，系室宿。 玄胎平育天帝刘度内鲜，正音云：飘翰默然天炁赤，系危宿。 元明文举天帝丑法轮，正音云：开生舒天炁苍，系虚宿。 上明七曜摩夷天帝恬懀延，正音云：延虚明天炁黑，系女宿。 虚无越衡天帝正定光，正音云：镜无翘天炁碧，系牛宿。 太极蒙翳天帝曲育九昌，正音云：阿难洋明天炁紫，系斗宿。 赤明和阳天帝理禁上真，正音云：治安保仙天炁白，系梵炁。 玄明恭华天帝空谣丑音，正音云：飞音洞灵天炁黄，系箕宿。 曜明宗飘天帝重光明，正音云：翘贞英天炁绿，系尾宿。 竺落皇笳天帝摩夷妙辩，正音云：难玄明天炁青，系心宿。 虚明堂曜天帝阿娄生，正音云：弥纶玄明天炁赤，系房宿。 观明端靖天帝郁密罗千，正音云：朗观曜明天炁苍，系氏宿。 玄明恭庆天帝龙罗菩题，正音云：威清道玄天炁黑，系亢宿。 太焕极瑶天帝宛黎无延，正音云：洞真永观天炁碧，系角宿。 元载孔升天帝开真定光，正音云：开光竟真天炁紫，系梵炁。 太安皇崖天帝婆娄阿贪，正音云：晖莫阿魂天炁白，系诊宿。 显定极风天帝招真童，正音云：回翘威天炁黄，系翼宿。 始皇孝芒天帝萨罗娄王，正音云：君华大权天炁绿，系张宿。 太皇翁重浮容天帝闵巴狂，正音云：惠威光天炁青，系星宿。 无思江由天帝明梵光，正音云：朗法元天炁赤，系柳宿。 上揲阮乐天帝勃勃监，正音云：郁元真星天炁苍，系鬼宿。 无极昙誓天帝飘弩穹隆，正音云：飞天虚英天炁黑，系井宿。 皓庭霄度天帝慧觉昏，正音云：无清明天炁碧，系梵炁。 渊通元洞天帝梵行观生，正音云：法权道先天炁紫，系参宿。 太文翰宠妙成天帝那育丑瑛，正音云：虚熏慧光天炁白，系赀宿。 太素秀乐禁上天帝龙罗觉长，正音云：阳威耀靖天炁黄，系毕宿。 太虚无上常融天帝总监鬼神，正音云：摄灵真天炁绿，系昴宿。 太释玉隆腾胜天帝眇眇行元，正音云：空微道明天炁青，系胃宿。

Beneath the six firm yang lines, a single yielding line transforms, and yin qi takes effect, gradually descending to gather within the Central Palace, where the divine maiden and numinous youth conjoin yin and yang in the chamber of spirit. Soaring dragons and crouching tigers unite hun and po within the womb of the mother—thus is it called "receiving deliverance." "Kalpa upon kalpa" signifies day after day. As yang ascends and yin descends, life returns to its root, wondrous transformations endless, cycling without cease—hence "abiding kalpa upon kalpa." Now yang is exhausted above yet reborn below, circulating without end, accompanying the body from beginning to end—thus "revolving with the kalpa’s wheel, matching heaven’s years." Through unceasing practice and flawless fire timing, both form and spirit attain perfection, merging with the Dao in truth—thus "forever transcending the three paths, five sufferings, and eight difficulties, ascending beyond the three realms, and roaming freely in the Shangqing."

The heavens of Shangqing, where the Heavenly Emperor of Jade Perfection dwells in the primal-hued radiance of pure conduct. The *Inner Meaning* states: Xue Youqi says: The Heavenly Emperor of the Shangqing heavens refers to the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors. The most exalted among them, whose Dao equals that of the Primordial Beginning and whose rank is arrayed in the Jade Purity, is called the Jade Perfection. These are the thirty-six heavens below Shangqing, distinct from the thirty-two heavens. Possessing radiance yet devoid of color, hence it is called "pure conduct." Pure conduct is the Dao within the Dao, the heaven within heaven, entering and exiting without obstruction, true emptiness without hindrance.

From the inner perspective, when the elixir is perfected, it assumes the image of pure yang qian metal. Qian employs the nine of metal, and the number four times nine is thirty-six. The Dao equals that of the Primordial Beginning—all is one qi. Ranked among the Jade Purity—wondrous unity pervades all. When metal returns to the origin of nature, one attains radiance without color. At this stage of returning the elixir, all yin is exhausted, the yang body is wholly complete, and the heart-mind shines with clarity, ascending into the mysterious and entering the wondrous, like the limpid azure of autumn skies or the still depths of a cold pool. The slightest deviation would blind the eye—how then could one attain the colorless radiance of pure conduct?

chunks.original_text: 龙变梵度天帝运上玄玄，正音云：相灵妙光天炁赤； 系娄宿。 太极平育贾奕天帝大择法门。 正音云：永玄九生天炁苍，系奎宿。 《内义》曰：此诸天玉讳玉音，皆以赤晶之玉，碧字刻之，秘於上清宫中。 持经之士，不请读诵。 三十二天之中，天中之人寿命有数，且如皇曾天人寿九百万岁，从此向上，每天皆一倍因之，则太明玉完天人寿一千八百万岁。 又倍因之，何童天人寿三千六百万岁。 倍而因之，至秀乐禁上天，人寿一千二百七万七千九百五十七万一千二百万岁。 此二十八天，是为三界，即欲界、色界、无色界也。 欲界者，下界也。 欲界有六天，自黄曾至七曜天是。 此天之人，有形有欲，触物染着。 初上二天以身交为欲，次二天以执手为欲，第五天以口说为欲，第六天以眼视为欲。 谓有色欲，交接阴阳，人民胎生，故云欲界。 一歌根净，上进一天，六欲根净，即登色界。 色界者，中界也。 色界有十八天，自越衡天至昙誓天是。 此天之人有形无欲，而有六色十八尘，曰六粗尘、六细尘、六轻尘。 一粗尘净，上进一天，六粗尘净，则进六天。 又六细尘，一细尘净上进一天，六细尘净复进六天。 又六轻尘，一轻尘净，上进一天，六轻尘净，升入无色之界。 无色界者，上界也。 无色界四天，自皓庭至秀乐天是。 《太真科》曰：无色界之中，至真无情，不交阴阳，人民化生，但啖香炁，无复形质之患。 故色欲俱空，修至第一天，唯存心识以入炁，观炁观道，成即升一天。 尚有心识，若能舍除心识，以至无为，复升一天。 前因都忘，心识即居此天。 此天不使都忘，故应用即有不为，即无若空，有都无即，失真中之应。 以其空中有真，真中有应，生成万象，皆出於空； 万法在心，亦无形相； 将令学者观心，若有若无，又升一天。 炁观转妙，结习都忘，洞入自然，即升种民之天。 《太真科》曰：无色界中，人身微妙，无复形色； 或形长数百丈，而人不见，唯真人能见之。 以其无形可见，故云无色。 但三界之人，生死之根未断，阴阳之炁犹存，尚隶乎数。 寿岁有尽，或升入上境，或下生人中，随功高下，轮转无穷。 唯得道乃己自常融，至平育天，曰四种民天，寿数亦因倍而见。 一云：此四天人出二炁之外，无年寿之限，喜乐清静。 故《本际经》云：结习已尽，超种民位。 谓烦恼为结，学业为习。 《太真科》曰：上升四天，洞入道境，随炁升降，灾所不及。 以上三十二天炁及所系星宿，见《洞神经》。 人寿岁数、根尘染净，见《龙蹻经》。 其余见李少微、成玄英之注释矣。 数者，始於一炁，道生一、太极生两仪是也。 既隶乎数，必有其终，此其所以难逃生死也。 天人寿数可得而推者是隶数也o 故不免有轮回坠堕所以傅大士曰：饶经百万劫，终是落空亡。 释氏谓十种仙是矣。 此乃有为小乘，即缘觉、声闻之俦，以其未造清静无为之故。 若金丹者，契虚合无，形神俱妙，出於炁数之表，岂生死、寿岁、形相可得而拘乎！ 薛幽栖曰：四方之天三十二者，谓四梵天也。 天帝高尊，形相宛然，虽有真相，犹如虚空； 出入无间，不阂於物。 馑按经云：元始祖劫，化生诸天。 则三十二天皆一炁之所化。 还丹之修，本於一炁，功成道备，空洞无迹，亦若诸天帝尊虽有真相，犹如虚空者也。

The Heavenly Emperor of Longbian Fandu Heaven, Yunshang Xuanxuan: Xiangling Miaoguang. The correct intonation: "Numinous Radiance, Wondrous Light—Heavenly Qi of Red, linked to the Bond Mansion."
The Heavenly Emperor of Taiji Pingyu Jiayi Heaven, Daze Famen: Yongxuan Jiusheng. The correct intonation: "Eternal Mystery, Ninefold Life—Heavenly Qi of Blue-Green, linked to the Straddling Mansion."

The *Inner Meaning* states: These jade names and jade intonations of the various heavens are all inscribed in azure script upon red crystal jade and concealed within the Supreme Clarity Palace. Those who hold this scripture may not request to read or recite them.

Among the thirty-two heavens, the lifespans of their inhabitants are fixed by number. For instance, the people of Huangzeng Heaven live nine million years, and from this point upward, each heaven’s lifespan doubles in succession. Thus, the people of Taiming Yuwan Heaven live eighteen million years. Doubling again, the people of Hetong Heaven live thirty-six million years. Continuing this doubling, the people of Xiule Jin Shang Heaven live 1,207,795,712 million years.

These twenty-eight heavens constitute the Three Realms: the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm. The Realm of Desire is the lower realm. It comprises six heavens, from Huangzeng to the Seven Luminaries Heaven. The inhabitants of these heavens possess form and desire, clinging to sensory attachments. In the first two heavens, desire is expressed through bodily union; in the next two, through hand-holding; in the fifth heaven, through speech; and in the sixth, through gaze. As they engage in carnal desire, procreating through sexual union, and giving birth to offspring, this is called the Realm of Desire. When one sense-root is purified, one ascends to the next heaven; when all six sense-roots are purified, one enters the Realm of Form.

The Realm of Form is the middle realm. It comprises eighteen heavens, from Yueheng Heaven to Tanshi Heaven. The inhabitants of these heavens possess form but no desire, though they are subject to six colors and eighteen dusts—six coarse dusts, six fine dusts, and six subtle dusts. When one coarse dust is purified, one ascends to the next heaven; when all six coarse dusts are purified, one advances six heavens. Likewise, for the six fine dusts, purifying one fine dust allows ascent to the next heaven, and purifying all six fine dusts advances one six heavens further. For the six subtle dusts, purifying one subtle dust allows ascent to the next heaven, and purifying all six subtle dusts elevates one into the Formless Realm.

The Formless Realm is the upper realm. It comprises four heavens, from Haoting to Xiule Heaven. The *Code of Supreme Perfection* states: Within the Formless Realm, the perfected are without emotion, do not engage in sexual union, and their people are born through transformation. They subsist solely on fragrant qi, free from the afflictions of form and substance. Thus, with both form and desire extinguished, one cultivates to reach the first heaven, retaining only consciousness to merge with qi, contemplating qi and the Dao, and upon attainment, ascending to the next heaven. If consciousness still remains, one must relinquish it to attain non-action and ascend further. When all past causes are forgotten, consciousness abides in this heaven. Here, one does not entirely forget, so when action is required, there is response; when non-action is called for, there is emptiness. If one clings to either emptiness or existence, one loses the responsiveness within the true. For within emptiness lies the true, and within the true lies responsiveness—all phenomena arise from emptiness. The myriad dharmas reside in the mind, yet lack form or appearance. Guiding practitioners to contemplate the mind as neither existent nor non-existent, one ascends further. As the contemplation of qi becomes increasingly subtle, all habitual tendencies are forgotten, and one merges with spontaneity, ascending to the heaven of the Seed People.

The *Code of Supreme Perfection* states: Within the Formless Realm, the bodies of its inhabitants are wondrous and subtle, devoid of form or color. Some may be hundreds of feet tall, yet remain invisible to ordinary beings—only the perfected can perceive them. As they are without visible form, this is called the Formless Realm. However, the people of the Three Realms have not severed the root of birth and death, and the qi of yin and yang still lingers, binding them to numerical fate. Their lifespans are finite; they may ascend to higher realms or descend to the human world, their rebirth determined by the measure of their merit, endlessly revolving. Only those who attain the Dao transcend this cycle, reaching the ever-harmonious Pingyu Heaven—the Four Seed-People Heavens, where lifespans also double in succession.

One account states: The people of these four heavens exist beyond the dual qi, unbound by limits of years or lifespan, abiding in joy and purity. Thus, the *Sutra of the Fundamental Limit* says: "When habitual tendencies are exhausted, one transcends the station of the Seed People." Here, *knots* refer to afflictions, and *habits* to the fruits of study.

The *Code of Supreme Perfection* states: Ascending through the four heavens, one merges with the realm of the Dao, rising and falling with the qi, untouched by calamity. The qi of the thirty-two heavens and their corresponding stellar lodges are recorded in the *Scripture of Cavernous Spirit*. The lifespans of their inhabitants and the purification of sense-roots and dusts are found in the *Scripture of the Dragon’s Ascent*. Other details appear in the commentaries of Li Shaowei and Cheng Xuanying.

Numbers begin with the primordial qi: the Dao generates the One, and the Supreme Ultimate generates the Two Modes. Once bound to number, there must be an end—this is why escape from birth and death is so difficult. The lifespans of heavenly beings can be calculated because they are bound to number, and thus cannot avoid the cycles of rebirth and descent. Hence, Master Fu said: "Though one endures for a hundred thousand kalpas, one ultimately falls into emptiness and annihilation." The Buddhists refer to the ten kinds of immortals as such. These are the lesser vehicles of conditioned action, akin to the Pratyekabuddhas and Śrāvakas, for they have not yet attained the purity of non-action. But those who refine the Golden Elixir merge with emptiness and unite with the formless; both form and spirit become wondrous, transcending the bounds of qi and number. How could birth, death, lifespan, or form confine them?

Xue Youqi said: The thirty-two heavens of the four directions refer to the Four Brahma Heavens. The Heavenly Emperors are supremely exalted, their forms distinct yet ephemeral, like empty space. They move without obstruction, unobstructed by phenomena.

I, Jing, note that the scriptures say: In the primordial kalpa of the Original Beginning, all heavens were transformed from the primordial qi. Thus, the thirty-two heavens are all manifestations of a single qi. The practice of the Returned Elixir originates from this primordial qi. When merit is perfected and the Dao attained, one becomes empty and traceless, just as the Heavenly Emperors, though possessing true forms, are like empty space.

chunks.original_text: 然诸天之宝讳为券，可以济拔苦爽； 而一炁之还元成丹，是能度脱凡躯。 事异道同，功殊理一。 已上正文，元始天尊所说。 三十二天，三十二帝，诸天隐讳，诸天隐名，天中空洞，自然灵章。 诸天隐韵，天中之音，天中之尊，天中之神，天中大魔，天中之灵，九和十合，变化上清。 无量之奥，深不可详。 敷落神真，普度天人。 《内义》曰：诸天诸帝，隐讳隐名，灵章音韵，神尊魔灵者，象一炁所化，而为铅银、砂汞、龙虎、水火、丹药异名之类也。 九和十合，即阴阳交缔，相生相成。 变化上清，乃阳极於乾，阴生於午矣。 造化无迹，阴阳无端，玉晨道主犹云：无量之奥，深不可详。 况末学乎！ ．关令有言：譬如大海能变化亿万蛟鱼，水一而已。 我之与物，蓊然郁然，在大化中，性一而已。 由此观之，故造化之机可得而窥，所以究经道之玄微，依返还之妙理，推寻药物，本认丹基。 明铅银砂汞之机，运日月阴阳之用，期以长年度世，入圣登真，流传真谛，自利利他，此所谓敷落神真、普度天人耳。 已上正文，玉晨道君序述。 今日欣庆受度，历关诸天，今日谓元始以经授付道君之日。 请灭三恶，谓三徒也。 斩绝地根，谓地狱也。 飞度五户，谓五苦也。 名列太玄，谓玄都也。 魔王监举，无拘天门。 《洞神经升天券》，出皇人文中第六十八字，以清素带身。 道士临升天之日，五岳不见此券，则拘人魂魄，不得同升。 江河淮海不得此券，则留人血液，不得同升。 地官不得此券，则拘人形，不得升度。 天官不得此券，则拘闭天门，不使升进。 天门史士呵禁求券，得券则前入紫府，见大道君，然后一切诸神不敢拘制也。 《内义》日：今日欣庆受度者，丹成也。 丹成者，阳神萃於乾宫，直登三界。 阴炁剥於坤户，超脱五行，故曰历关诸天，请灭三恶，斩绝地根。 飞度五户，名列太玄者，乃圣胎存於髓海，魔试不干，神灵赞佑，天门忽震，身外有身，是谓魔王监举，无拘天门。 已上正文，元始天尊所说。 东斗主算，西斗记名，北斗落死，南斗上生，中斗大魁，总监众灵。 《东斗长生护命经》云：东斗五星。 《西斗大计护身经》 云：西斗四星。 《北斗本命延生经》 云：北斗七星。 《南斗延寿度人经》 云：南斗六星。 《中斗大魁掌算伏魔经》 云：中斗三星。 或以东西南北七宿为四方之 斗，以今人所谓北斗为中斗，引《天官书》而证之，曰斗为帝车，运於中央，临制四方，以察妖祥。 以神州之人居极之南，自北而观，故曰北斗。 《真一口诀》云：斗中自有五斗，阳明为东斗，阴精为西斗，丹元为南斗，北极为北斗，天关为中斗。 所说不同，故并存之。 《内义》曰：得度之人，丹成之士，则四斗为之主算记名，落死上生。 中斗则总统其事。 585/3
chunks.translated_text:
Yet the secret talismanic names of the heavens serve as contracts to deliver souls from suffering, while the return of primordial qi to its origin to form the Elixir can liberate the mortal frame. Though the methods differ, the Dao is the same; though the merits vary, the principle is one.

The foregoing main text was spoken by the Most High Lord of the Original Beginning.

The thirty-two heavens, thirty-two emperors, the hidden names and secret appellations of the heavens, the empty void within the heavens, the spontaneous numinous scriptures—these are the hidden melodies of the heavens, the sounds within the heavens, the exalted ones within the heavens, the spirits within the heavens, the great demons within the heavens, the numina within the heavens. Nine harmonies and ten unions transform and ascend to the Upper Clarity. Their boundless mysteries are too profound to fathom. They spread forth the divine perfected to universally deliver heaven and humanity.

The *Inner Meaning* states: The hidden names and secret appellations of the heavens and emperors, the numinous scriptures and melodies, the divine, exalted, demonic, and numinous—these symbolize the single qi transformed into the various names of lead, silver, cinnabar, mercury, dragon, tiger, water, fire, and the Elixir. The nine harmonies and ten unions refer to the intertwining of yin and yang, mutually engendering and completing one another. Their transformation to ascend to the Upper Clarity occurs when yang reaches its zenith in *qian* and yin arises at *wu*. Creation leaves no trace; yin and yang have no beginning. Even the Jade Dawn Lord of the Dao has said: "Their boundless mysteries are too profound to fathom." How much more so for those of shallow learning!

Guan Ling once said: It is like the great sea, which can transform into countless dragons and fish, yet is but a single water. I and all things, flourishing and lush, exist within the great transformation—our natures are but one. From this perspective, the mechanism of creation may be glimpsed. Thus, by delving into the profound subtleties of the scriptures and the Dao, adhering to the wondrous principle of return, investigating the medicinal substances, and recognizing the foundation of the Elixir, one clarifies the workings of lead, silver, cinnabar, and mercury, and employs the functions of the sun and moon, yin and yang. The aim is to achieve long life and transcend the world, enter sagehood and ascend to perfected being, transmit the true essence, and benefit both self and others—this is what is meant by "spreading forth the divine perfected to universally deliver heaven and humanity."

The foregoing main text was composed by the Jade Dawn Lord of the Dao.

Today is the joyous occasion of receiving deliverance, passing through the barriers of the heavens—today refers to the day when the Original Beginning transmitted the scriptures to the Lord of the Dao. "Pleasing the eradication of the three evils" refers to the three paths of suffering. "Severing the roots of the earth" refers to hell. "Flying past the five gates" refers to the five sufferings. "Named among the Supreme Mystery" refers to the Mysterious Capital. The demon kings oversee and raise up, and the gates of heaven impose no restraints.

The *Heaven-Ascending Contract from the Wondrous Spirit Scripture* is the sixty-eighth character in the *August Writ of Humanity*, worn as a pure white sash on the body. On the day a Daoist ascends to heaven, if the Five Marchmounts do not see this contract, they will detain the soul and prevent it from ascending together. If the Jiang, He, Huai, and seas do not see this contract, they will retain the blood and fluids and prevent them from ascending together. If the Earth Bureau does not see this contract, it will detain the body and prevent ascension. If the Heaven Bureau does not see this contract, it will bar the gates of heaven and prevent advancement. The celestial gatekeepers demand the contract; upon obtaining it, one proceeds into the Purple Palace to meet the Great Lord of the Dao, after which all spirits dare not impose restraints.

The *Inner Meaning* states: "Today is the joyous occasion of receiving deliverance" refers to the completion of the Elixir. When the Elixir is complete, the yang spirit gathers in the *qian* palace and directly ascends the Three Realms. The yin qi is stripped away at the *kun* gate, transcending the Five Phases—hence "passing through the barriers of the heavens," "pleasing the eradication of the three evils," "severing the roots of the earth," "flying past the five gates," and "named among the Supreme Mystery." This occurs when the sacred embryo is stored in the sea of marrow, demonic trials do not disturb it, spirits and numina offer their aid, the gates of heaven suddenly open, and a body exists beyond the body—this is what is meant by "the demon kings oversee and raise up, and the gates of heaven impose no restraints."

The foregoing main text was spoken by the Most High Lord of the Original Beginning.

The Eastern Dipper governs destiny, the Western Dipper records names, the Northern Dipper decrees death, the Southern Dipper bestows life, and the Central Dipper, the Great Chief, oversees all spirits.

The *Scripture of the Eastern Dipper for Long Life and Protection of Destiny* states: The Eastern Dipper has five stars.
The *Scripture of the Western Dipper for Great Calculation and Protection of the Body* states: The Western Dipper has four stars.
The *Scripture of the Northern Dipper for Extension of Life Based on One’s Original Destiny* states: The Northern Dipper has seven stars.
The *Scripture of the Southern Dipper for Extending Lifespan and Delivering Humanity* states: The Southern Dipper has six stars.
The *Scripture of the Central Dipper, the Great Chief, for Calculating and Subduing Demons* states: The Central Dipper has three stars.

Some identify the Eastern, Western, Southern, and Northern Dippers with the seven lunar lodges in the four directions, taking what is now called the Northern Dipper as the Central Dipper. They cite the *Treatise on the Celestial Offices* as evidence, which states: "The Dipper is the emperor’s chariot, moving at the center to govern the four directions and observe portents." Since the people of the divine continent dwell south of the pole, when viewed from the north, it is called the Northern Dipper.

The *True One Oral Instructions* states: Within the Dipper itself are five dippers: Yang Brightness is the Eastern Dipper, Yin Essence is the Western Dipper, Cinnabar Prime is the Southern Dipper, the Northern Culmen is the Northern Dipper, and the Celestial Pass is the Central Dipper. The accounts differ, so both are preserved here.

The *Inner Meaning* states: For those who have attained deliverance and completed the Elixir, the four Dippers govern their destiny, record their names, decree death, and bestow life. The Central Dipper oversees all these matters.
